title: nbdev_cards
text: A deck of cards demo of nbdev based on ideas from Think Python 2nd Edition by Allen B. Downey.

title: nbdev_cards
text:
Install
Install using:
pip install nbdev-cards
or:
conda install -c fastai nbdev-cards

title: nbdev_cards
text:
How to use
This lib provides a Card class you can use to create, display, and compare playing cards:

Card(2,3)

3❤️


Suits are numbered according to this list:

suits

['♣️', '♦️', '❤️', '♠️']

title: Card – A Basic Playing Card
text:
Comparison operators
Equality, Less than, and Greater than work on the rank and suit indices
For example: here are some defined comparison tests

test_eq(Card(suit=1, rank=3),Card(suit=1, rank=3))
test_ne(Card(suit=2, rank=3),Card(suit=1, rank=3))
test_ne(Card(suit=1, rank=4),Card(suit=1, rank=3))
assert Card(suit=1, rank=3) <= Card(suit=1, rank=4)
assert Card(suit=1, rank=4) >= Card(suit=1, rank=3)


assert Card(suit=1, rank=2)<Card(suit=1, rank=3)


c1=Card(suit=1,rank=3)
c2=Card(suit=1,rank=4)
c3=Card(suit=1,rank=3)
c4=Card(suit=2,rank=3)


assert c1<c2
assert c1<=c3
assert c4>c2
assert c1>=c3
assert Card(suit=3, rank=3)>Card(suit=2, rank=3)
assert not Card(suit=1, rank=3)>Card(suit=2, rank=3)
